body: LEAD: The Dazzle of Evil The Dazzle of Evil Nothing is more fascinating than the failings of great artists. body: LEAD: BOXING Stewart Ties a Record: Alex Stewart of Brooklyn tied the record of 24 consecutive knockouts at the beginning of a heavyweight career when he stopped Terry Armstrong in the third round last night at Felt Forum. Referee Arthur Mercante Jr. stopped the bout at 1 minute 25 seconds of the third round of the scheduled 10-round bout. BOXING
title: RESULTS PLUS

title: Charter Panel Edgy on Forming Public Consensus

body: LEAD: AS FOUR YEARS OF INTENSIVE dramatic training wind to a close, the drama students from the Juilliard School demonstrate the art of stage combat in scenes of their own design commonly known as ''the fights.'' body: LEAD: Two armed men held up guards making a payroll delivery at a Brooklyn nursing home yesterday, making off with an estimated $200,000, the police said. Two armed men held up guards making a payroll delivery at a Brooklyn nursing home yesterday, making off with an estimated $200,000, the police said. The men fled after confronting the guards
title: Heist Nets $200,000 At a Nursing Home

body: LEAD: Sheldon Weinberg owned a modest dress shop in Brooklyn before he and his sons branched off into Medicaid ventures.
